org.sakaiproject.content.api

Interface ResourceType

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ExpandableResourceType, SiteSpecificResourceType
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseResourceType, BasicResourceType, BasicSiteSelectableResourceType, FileUploadType, FolderType, FormResourceType, HtmlDocumentType, TextDocumentType, UrlResourceType

    public interface ResourceType

    • Method Detail

      • getActions

        List<ResourceToolAction> getActions(ResourceToolAction.ActionType type)
        Access the action specified by the parameter. If the action is defined for this resource type, it is returned. Otherwise, the method returns null.
        Parameters:
        type -
        Returns:

      • getActions

        List<ResourceToolAction> getActions(List<ResourceToolAction.ActionType> types)
        Access an ordered list of actions specified by the parameter. The actions are added to the list in the order specified by the parametric list. If none of the action types specified in the list are defined for this resource type, the returned list will be empty.
        Parameters:
        types -
        Returns:

      • getAction

        ResourceToolAction getAction(String actionId)
        Parameters:
        actionId -
        Returns:

      • getIconLocation

        String getIconLocation(ContentEntity entity)
        Retrieve a reference for the location of the icon for this type. This should be relative to the image library in "/reference/library/src/webapp/image/". For example, the plain-text image is "sakai/text.gif"; If null, the mimetype of the resource or other info may be used to find an icon, which may be inappropriate for a particular resource type. In the case of folders and other expandable resources, the value returned by this method will be used for top-level folders within a site because, those folders are expanded by default.
        Parameters:
        entity - The entity for which the icon is needed, or null, especially in cases where a specific entity has not yet been created.
        Returns:
        A path to the icon relative to the root of the image library in "/reference/library/src/webapp/image/", or null

      • getId

        String getId()
        Access the identifier for this type (which must be unique within the registry and must be limited to alphnumeric characters).
        Returns:

      • getLabel

        String getLabel()
        Returns:

      • getLocalizedHoverText

        String getLocalizedHoverText(ContentEntity entity)
        Access a text string suitable for use as a very brief description of a particular resource. If the string is more than about 40 or 50 characters, it may be truncated at an arbitrary length. The string may identify the type of this resource or more specific information. If the entity parameter is null, the method should return a more general description of the the entity (suitable for a new entity during creation dialogs). The string should be localized. If no return value is supplied, a default hover-string will be used.
        Parameters:
        entity - The resource that's being displayed, or null indicating that the entity might not yet exist.
        Returns:

      • getSizeLabel

        String getSizeLabel(ContentEntity entity)
        Access a short string that describes the "size" of an entity in some appropriate way. For example, the "size" of a folder might be the number of items it contains, the "size" of a text document might be the number of bytes it contains, and the "size" of a audio file might be its playing time at a normal speed. If the method returns null, the Resources tool will display the number of bytes if the entity is a ContentResource or the number of members if the entity is a ContentCollection. The string must be short. If it's longer than about 18 characters, it may be truncated arbitrarily, which may render it meaningless to users.
        Parameters:
        entity - The resource that's being displayed, or null indicating that the entity might not yet exist.
        Returns:
        A short string describing the size of an entity, or null.
        See Also:
        MAX_LENGTH_SHORT_SIZE_LABEL

      • getLongSizeLabel

        String getLongSizeLabel(ContentEntity entity)
        Access a short string that describes the "size" of an entity in some appropriate way. For example, the "size" of a folder might be the number of items it contains, the "size" of a text document might be the number of bytes it contains, and the "size" of a audio file might be its playing time at a normal speed. If the method returns null, the Resources tool will display the number of bytes if the entity is a ContentResource or the number of members if the entity is a ContentCollection. The string must be short. If it's longer than about 80 characters, it may be truncated arbitrarily, which may render it meaningless to users.
        Parameters:
        entity - The resource that's being displayed, or null indicating that the entity might not yet exist.
        Returns:
        A short string describing the size of an entity, or null.
        See Also:
        MAX_LENGTH_LONG_SIZE_LABEL

      • hasAvailabilityDialog

        boolean hasAvailabilityDialog()
        Should the Resources tool support hiding and scheduled release and/or retraction for items of this type?
        Returns:
        true if availability is included among the resource properties in the UI, false otherwise.

      • hasDescription

        boolean hasDescription()
        Should the Resources tool elicit a description for items of this type?
        Returns:
        true if a description is included among the resource properties in the UI, false otherwise.

      • hasGroupsDialog

        boolean hasGroupsDialog()
        Should the Resources tool support access by groups for items of this type?
        Returns:
        true if access by groups is included among the resource properties in the UI, false otherwise.

      • hasNotificationDialog

        boolean hasNotificationDialog()
        Should the Resources tool support optional email notification for items of this type?
        Returns:
        true if email-notification is included among the resource properties in the UI, false otherwise.

      • hasOptionalPropertiesDialog

        boolean hasOptionalPropertiesDialog()
        Should the Resources tool allow specification of "optional properties" (usually Dublin Core tags) for items of this type?
        Returns:
        true if optional properties form is included among the resource properties in the UI, false otherwise.

      • hasPublicDialog

        boolean hasPublicDialog()
        Should the Resources tool support making items of this type public?
        Returns:
        true if public access is included among the resource properties in the UI, false otherwise.

      • hasRightsDialog

        boolean hasRightsDialog()
        Should the Resources tool elicit copyright/licensing for items of this type?
        Returns:
        true if the copyright/licensing dialog is included among the resource properties in the UI, false otherwise.

      • isExpandable

        boolean isExpandable()
        Indicates whether this resource type is one for which an "expand" action is available. If this method returns true, the ResourceType registration must implement the ExpandableResourceType interface and provide action definitions of type "expand" and "collapse".
        Returns:
